title: US Vice-President Mike Pence's aide tests positive for coronavirus
description: The diagnosis comes one day after Trump's personal valet tested positive for the virus.

title: Coronavirus: Public urged to watch out for fake products after 'surge' in reports
description: Councils have seen a "significant surge" in criminal activity, including the sale of bogus medical kit.

title: Coronavirus: Compulsory vaccines in the UK and other rumours fact-checked
description: A round-up of what's been debunked includes rumours about mandatory coronavirus vaccines and patents.

title: Coronavirus: How is Suffolk's Little America coping in lockdown?
description: How are the communities that rely so heavily on the US airbases coping under lockdown?

title: Coronavirus: Bread and cake tips from a self-isolating baker
description: Ray normally runs his family bakery, Rinkoffs, but is currently staying at home with his wife.

title: Coronavirus: Young men 'more likely to ignore lockdown'
description: Psychologists find they are more likely to meet friends than women.

title: Coronavirus in the UK: The first 100 days
description: How the government's policy has shifted from the first recorded case to the PM being treated in ICU.

title: Coronavirus: Six money-saving ideas for lockdown and beyond
description: Millions of people are facing pay cuts or less work, so how can you make your money go further?

title: Norfolk Island morepork owls: Major breakthrough for rare species
description: Two fledglings may have safeguarded the future of the Norfolk Island morepork owl.

title: Chvrches singer Lauren Mayberry on lockdown life in LA
description: Lauren Mayberry talks to the BBC's Unlocked podcast about lockdown in LA, social media and abusive relationships.

title: VE Day celebrations: The UK marks 75th anniversary
description: An RAF flypast and a national minute's silence are among the events marking the 75th anniversary.

title: Coronavirus: Lockdown remains in Wales but exercise rules eased
description: People will be allowed to exercise more than once a day, First Minister Mark Drakeford says.

title: VE Day: UK marking 75th anniversary of end of WW2 in Europe
description: The Red Arrows fly over London as the Royals lead the nation in commemorating the end of WW2 in Europe.

title: Coronavirus lockdown: UK 'should not expect big changes'
description: The PM will set out a "cautious" road map for the UK in his speech on Sunday, a cabinet minister says.

title: Andrew Robertson on Lionel Messi, partying with Kenny Dalglish and M&S lingerie
description: Liverpool defender Andrew Robertson joins That Peter Crouch Podcast to discuss some of his most memorable moments.

title: Players can 'get over' neutral venues to give country 'positive boost', says Mee
description: Burnley defender Ben Mee believes players will deal with neutral venues and quarantine if it means the Premier League can resume.

title: Ahmaud Arbery: Father and son charged with murder of US black jogger
description: Ahmaud Arbery was on a residential street in February when he was confronted by the pair.

title: 'I'm being harassed,' says Man City defender
description: Manchester City and England defender Kyle Walker says he feels he is "being harassed" after it was reported he had broken social distancing rules again.

title: Moeen wants England Test return once cricket resumes
description: Moeen Ali tells the Doosra podcast he has only "two or three more years" left of playing top-level cricket for England.

title: VE Day: Southampton goalkeeper Arthur House on fighting in World War II
description: Southampton academy players visit Arthur House, a former Saints keeper whose playing career ended when he went to fight in World War II.

title: Big quiz: Can you name every British Premier League manager?
description: There have been 122 British managers in the Premier League - but can you name them all in 30 minutes?

title: Last-gasp heroics, 65-yard screamers & bicycle kicks - some of the great goals from keepers
description: Goalkeepers scoring goals - is there anything better in football? To mark 21 years since that Jimmy Glass goal, BBC Sport looks at 10 memorable goalkeeper goals.

title: VE Day: Berlin marks end of WW2 in Europe with unprecedented holiday
description: It is a one-off holiday in the German capital, but some think it should be marked nationally each year.

title: VE Day: 'I drove general to WW2 peace treaty signing'
description: Marjorie Morgan, who was at the signing in Reims, is among veterans sharing their VE Day memories.

title: Newspaper headlines: 'Hope' on VE Day and lockdown latest
description: Many papers mark Victory in Europe Day on the front pages, as the UK prepares to mark it in lockdown.

title: Coronavirus lockdown sends solo sailor on Pacific odyssey
description: One man's dream sailing trip nearly ended in disaster as island nations began closing their borders.

title: VE Day: Last Nazi message intercepted by Bletchley Park revealed
description: Released to mark VE Day 75 years on, the message reports British troops entering a Nazi stronghold.

title: Supermoon lights up night skies around the world
description: Known as the Flower Moon, this is the last of three supermoons to take place during this year.

title: In pictures: How VE Day was celebrated
description: People celebrate VE Day across Britain, following Germany's surrender in 1945.
